title.rendered: 10 Best Adobe XD Courses to Take in 2023

content.rendered:
Here is an up-to-date guide of the best courses built from Class Central’s catalog of Adobe XD courses, and selected according to a well-defined methodology that you can check below.

But if you’re in a hurry, here are my top picks:

Course Workload In Brief
1. Adobe XD for Beginners | FREE COURSE (Envato Tuts+) 2-3 hours Adobe XD free course that covers all the basics to get you started
2. User Experience Design Essentials – Adobe XD UI UX Design (Udemy) 10 hours The most comprehensive course for beginners
3. Adobe Xd Tutorial for Beginners (The Net Ninja) 1-2 hours Intro to Adobe XD, a great overview in this free course
4. Learning Adobe XD (LinkedIn Learning) 5 hours Learn how to go from concept to interactive prototype
5. Introduction to Adobe XD (Domestika) 3-4 hours Start from scratch and improve your design workflow with advanced resources
6. Adobe XD Essential Training: Design with Dani Beaumont (LinkedIn Learning) 3-4 hours Create and collaborate on web and mobile app designs for beginners
7. Adobe XD Essential Training: Design with Demian Borba (LinkedIn Learning) 2-3 hours Set up a design project, use artboards and grids, and start working with vector design tools
8. Introducción a Adobe XD para aplicaciones móviles (Domestika) 7-8 hours Spanish course on how to design an app for iOS and Android like a professional
9. Prototyping a WordPress Project in Adobe XD (LinkedIn Learning) 2-3 hours Create a WordPress website prototype that you can share with your clients and developers
10. Creación de prototipos interactivos con Adobe XD (Domestika) 2-3 hours Spanish course on how to create accurate animated prototypes for digital products

What is Adobe XD?

Adobe XD (also known as Adobe Experience Design) is Adobe’s tool for prototyping user experience and creating designs with interactivity. Adobe XD features are used for creating wireframes, prototypes, and screen designs for digital products for web and mobile.

You can purchase Adobe XD as a standalone app for a monthly subscription of about $10, or all Adobe apps for about $55 (20+ Creative Cloud apps, including XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, and After Effects). Bear in mind there are other alternatives in the market if you are only interested in creating web and mobile designs, such as Figma and Sketch. If you want, check here our list for Best Figma Courses and Best Sketch Courses.

Course Ranking Methodology

I built this ranking following the now tried-and-tested methodology used in previous rankings (you can find them all here). It involves a three-step process:

  1. Research: I started by leveraging Class Central’s database with over 80K+ online courses and 170K reviews. Then, I made a preliminary selection of 80+ Adobe XD courses by rating, reviews, and bookmarks.
  2. Evaluate: I read through reviews on Class Central, Reddit, and course providers to understand what other learners thought about each course and combined it with my own experience as a learner.
  3. Select: Well-made courses were picked if they presented valuable and engaging content and they have to fit in a set of criteria and be ranked accordingly: release date, comprehensive curriculum, selling price, ratings and enrollments.

Course Ranking Statistics

Here are some aggregate stats about the ranking:

  • 2 courses are Free and 7 are Paid.
  • 8 courses are in English, and 2 in Spanish with English subtitles.
  • Together, they account for 588,364 enrollments and YouTube views.
  • The most featured provider is LinkedIn Learning with 4 courses.

1. Adobe XD for Beginners | FREE COURSE (Envato Tuts+)

This is #1 pick with this free and comprehensive Adobe XD tutorial for complete beginners you will learn everything you need to get started with Adobe XD: artboards, components, responsive design, and more with Adi Purdila who is a knowledgeable and didactic instructor from Envato Tuts+.

This course was amazing! It was easy to follow. Because I’m already familiar with Adobe products I knew where you were going and what certain tools did, but I don’t think a very new beginner would find it hard to follow and get started. Excellent course! Excellent use of my time. – Jiexi Ai, learner

What You’ll Learn

In this Adobe XD full course, you’ll learn everything you need to know about how to use Adobe XD. It starts by covering the basics like working with artboards, shapes, and images, and then moves on to more advanced features like working with assets and creating responsive layouts. In the final chapter, we’ll also learn how to create an Adobe XD prototype and how to work with Adobe XD auto-animate.

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 15 parts, you will learn by following along with the instructor and experimenting with the tool by yourself.

Institution Envato Tuts+
Provider YouTube
Instructor(s) Adi Purdila
Level Beginner
Workload 2-3 hours
Enrollments 392,762 views
Rating 10k thumbs up
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Envato Tuts+ has 2 other courses on Adobe XD: Adobe XD Auto-Animate: From Beginner to Advanced and Advanced Adobe XD | FREE COURSE.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

2. User Experience Design Essentials – Adobe XD UI UX Design (Udemy)

Learn how to use Adobe XD in this comprehensive course with specialist and best seller instructor Daniel Walter Scott. By the end of this course, you will be able to produce practical and effective User Experience (UX) and User Interface (UI) designs using Adobe XD by following a real-life project for a website and mobile app interface. This course is for beginners in Adobe XD or in the field of UX design.

I like how Dan gives some space for personal critical thinking on our design work. I also like how he gives comprehensive instructions on each segment of the course allows us to practice what we have learnt on mini projects. Overall I like this kind of teach-and-practice approach of learning. Thank you Dan! – Ang Kian H.

What You’ll Learn

Some topics covered in this course:

  • Wireframing Low Fidelity: Artboards & how wide should my website or app be in Adobe XD
  • Working with type, Rectangles, Circles, Buttons and Rounded corners
  • How to add interaction to your prototype in Adobe XD
  • Getting started with auto-animations in Adobe XD
  • Sharing Wireframes for comments
  • Mood Boards & resources for Hi fidelity UI design
  • How to create a color palette, save and reused color swatches
  • Drawing & editing shapes, learn to draw with the pen tool
  • Masking & cropping images

How You’ll Learn

This course is divided into 21 modules and 84 bite-sized lectures. You can learn by following along with the instructor using the provided downloadable resources. By the end of each module, you will be invited to work on a mini project, in total there are 17 class projects to work on your own.

Provider Udemy
Instructor(s) Daniel Walter Scott
Level Beginner
Workload 10 hours
Enrollments 158,941
Rating 4.7 (39,519)
Certificate Available

Fun Facts

  • Daniel Walter Scott is a best seller course instructor on Udemy who is also an Adobe Certified Instructor.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

3. Adobe Xd Tutorial for Beginners (The Net Ninja)

In this introductory and free course brought by The Net Ninja, you will learn how to use Adobe XD from scratch with Alex On Design, Adobe XD specialist. This is a perfect course for beginners who need to have an overview of the tool and find their way around.

What You’ll Learn

Some topics covered are: Download, Install & Updates;The Adobe XD Interface; Artboards; Shapes; Pen Tool; The Text Tool; Libraries; Layers; Plugins; Repeat Grid; 3D; Shortcuts; Working with Files; Design, Prototype & Share; and Exporting Files.

How You’ll Learn

This course covers the very basics of Adobe XD. If you are really new to this tool, you can follow along with the instructor and find your way around to start your projects.

Institution The Net Ninja
Provider YouTube
Instructor(s) Alex On Design
Level Beginner
Workload 1-2 hours
Enrollments 23,916 views
Rating 429 thumbs up
Certificate Not Available

Fun Facts

  • The instructor also has a YouTube channel where you can find tons of tutorials for Adobe XD.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

4. Learning Adobe XD (LinkedIn Learning)

In this course, instructor Tom Green provides a clear overview of the features and functionality in this design and prototyping tool, as well as how it can help you design compelling digital experiences. Tom gives a tour of its capabilities and features and shows the different ways you can share your prototypes. He also covers productivity-boosting features like 3D Transforms and new voice options, explaining how to go from concept to interactive prototype.

Excellent course! Fluid, clear step-by-step progress, keeps you interested and excited about what’s on the next chapter. I didn’t know what an AMAZING tool Adobe XD was!!!! – Nuria Sanchez

What You’ll Learn

  1. Getting Started: Learn the main features on Adobe XD interface;
  2. Extending XD: Plugins, UI kits, Icon sets, Creative Cloud Libraries, and Application integration;
  3. Building Screens in Design Mode: Artboards, Multiple Flows, Grids and guides, Repeat Grid, Scroll groups, Content-aware layout. Design System;
  4. Images, Vectors, Text, and Effects: Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, Using masks, Color, Using blurs, Icons, SVG edit, Text, and 3D transforms;
  5. Interactivity and Animation: Triggers and actions, eases, Component, Multiple Interactions, Overlays, Flows, Audio Playback;
  6. Let’s XD: card flip, animated login, Photo carousel, Progress bars and sliders, Common design pattern;
  7. Voice interactions;
  8. Publishing and Handoff, and much more.

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 8 modules and 75 bite-sized videos, you will learn by following along with the instructor and experimenting with Adobe XD by yourself. Each module ends with a quiz to test your knowledge and upon completion of all videos and activities you will receive a certificate to upload to your profile.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor(s) Tom Green
Level Beginner
Workload 5 hours
Enrollments 12,804
Rating 4.7 (206 ratings)
Certificate Available

Fun Facts

  • Tom Green is a teacher, author, and professor at Humber College’s School of Media & Information Technology.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

5. Introduction to Adobe XD (Domestika)

Learn with design specialist Ethan Parry, professor in Barcelona’s most reputed design universities. By the end of this course, you will be equipped with all necessary knowledge to take on a personal or professional UX design project.

Great course with excellent insight and information. Perfect for beginners and those looking to dive deeper into design. – questdotcom, learner

What You’ll Learn

In the first course, you will start by installing Adobe XD on your phone and computer, go through the layout of the software’s interface, and learn how to organize your workspace. Finish this course by trying out the design functions with Ethan.

Next, focus on designing an interface, learning the ins and outs of responsive design concepts to create the main screens of your application. Learn how to create components, create basic interactive prototypes, and finally how to use Adobe XD to showcase your designs.

Go a step further into prototyping with the third course, by creating dynamic effects and learning how to add carousels and voice to your prototype, along with micro-interactions with the use of component states. You’ll end this course by adding what you’ve learned to the designs you created in the previous course.

Discover how to share and collaborate on a UX project in the fourth course, seeing how to export artboards and elements by inviting someone to co-edit your design with you. See how to get feedback on your project so far, with the user testing mode.

In the final course, Ethan shares his tips and tricks to improve your design workflow using plugins, extensions, and UI kits. See where Ethan finds his plugins and apply various to your own app, to give a more dynamic design system to your final project.

How You’ll Learn

In this series of 5 courses/modules with 34 lessons in total, you will learn by following the instructions and using 22 downloadable resources to guide you through.

Provider Domestika
Instructor(s) Ethan Parry
Level Beginner
Workload 3-4 hours
Enrollments 6,916
Rating 99% positive (201 ratings)
Certificate Available

Fun Facts

  • Over the past few years, Ethan Perry has been part of the Interaction Design Association’s Interaction Awards committee, which recognizes and celebrates examples of excellence in Interaction Design across domains, channels, environments and cultures, and teaches UX design and agile methodology topics at several design universities and boot camps in Barcelona.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

6. Adobe XD Essential Training: Design with Dani Beaumont (LinkedIn Learning)

In this course, learn how to create and collaborate on web and mobile app designs using Adobe XD. Instructor Dani Beaumont, a principal product manager on Adobe XD, shows how to set up a design project and make use of the workspace layouts and tools. She also demonstrates how to use power capabilities such as Repeat Grid and the Libraries panel; build a component library with states and overrides, and more.

The instructor is clear. She does a great job by getting you used to using Adobe XD before jumping into the project. I think that is a great way to introduce the software. I have some pretty good experience using XD, however she mentions some shortcuts that are very helpful. – Brenden Brunnette, learner

What You’ll Learn

  • Get Started with Adobe XD: Create a document, artboards, open an existing file, save a cloud document, and work with document history.
  • Exploring the User Interface: Workspace layouts, Navigate the design canvas, Asset/Libraries panel, Panels.
  • Design Mode Basics: Exercise files, Rectangle and Ellipse tool, paste attributes, Converting shapes to path, Pen tool, Path vs line, Boolean operations, etc.
  • Layout Techniques: Guides, Grids, Align objects, Padding, Stacks, Responsive Resize, Repeat Grid.
  • Transform: Scale/rotate/flip, Scroll groups, 3D transforms.
  • Design Collaboration: Illustrator workflows, Adobe photoshop, Sketch app, Coediting.
  • Design Systems and Asset Organization: Filter, sort, and search, Extracting colors and characters styles, Revealing assets, Design systems intro, Publishing and consuming Creative Cloud Library, LInking assets, Converting Sketch files to libraries.

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 8 modules and 48 bite-sized videos, you will learn by following along with the instructor and experimenting with Adobe XD by yourself. Upon completion of all content you will receive a certificate to upload to your profile.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor(s) Dani Beaumont
Level Beginner
Workload 3-4 hours
Enrollments 10,928
Rating 4.8 (200 ratings)
Certificate Available

Fun Facts

  • This instructor has 2 other high-quality courses on Adobe XD: Adobe XD: Building a Responsive Component Library and Adobe XD Essential Training: Prototype & Share.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

7. Adobe XD Essential Training: Design with Demian Borba (LinkedIn Learning)

In this course, Instructor Demian Borba shows how to set up a design project, use artboards and grids, and start working with vector design tools. Find out how to access user interface (UI) starter kits from Apple, Google, Microsoft, and the community. Discover how to use power capabilities such as Repeat Grid and the Assets panel, components with powerful overrides, leverage files from other apps and Creative Cloud Libraries, resize elements, use plugins, collaborate in real time, and more.

It’s a great course for beginners. Instructor has very good knowledge and explained everything very well. – Sandeep S kumbar, learner

What You’ll Learn

  1. Get Started with Adobe XD: UI overview (Mac and Windows); Navigate the canvas; artboards and guides; Access incredible free UI kits; Square vs. layout grids; Layers and the selection model; The color picker; Linear and radial gradients.
  2. Design Mode Basics: Create and edit vector shapes; Pen tool and strokes; Point and area text; Work with masks; Bring images into shapes; Boolean operations; Copy and paste the appearance; Go faster with the Repeat Grid tool; Add images and text with Repeat Grid; Work with components and overrides; Blend modes and Edit in Photoshop
  3. Adaptive and Responsive Resize: Resize elements responsively; Nudge move and resize of elements; Padding for adaptive adjustments
  4. The Assets Panel: Add and manage colors; Add and manage text styles; Label and organize assets; Swap components; Link components across documents
  5. Connect with CC Libraries: Working with CC Libraries
  6. XD Plugins: Find plugins to extend XD
  7. Collaboration: Cloud vs. local documents; Versioning; Live coediting

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 8 modules and 38 videos, you will learn by following along with the instructor and experimenting with Adobe XD by yourself. Upon completion of all tutorials you will receive a certificate to upload to your profile.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor(s) Demian Borba
Level Beginner
Workload 2-3 hours
Enrollments 32,217
Rating 4.7 (376 ratings)
Certificate Available

Fun Facts

  • The instructor has 2 other courses on Adobe XD: Adobe XD Essential Training: Prototype and Share and Creating a Design System with Adobe XD.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

8. Introducción a Adobe XD para aplicaciones móviles (Domestika)

In this series, which comprises 5 courses by Arturo Servín, web designer and Adobe Certified Instructor, you will learn how to design an app for iOS and Android like a professional. This course audio is in Spanish, with subtitles in English.

I like how Arturo explains everything straight to the point, by the end of the course you can do your own app design in XD with no problems, you have all the relevant info to get started. – cristinamaria, learner

What You’ll Learn

The first thing you will do is understand the workflow of a document in Adobe XD, know the different modules of its interface, how to use the properties window and the work tables, and then create your first document in this software to start structuring the design of your application.

You will learn to use the tools to sort, align and distribute items within the work tables. You will create simple ways to turn them into icons that you will integrate into your application and see how you can develop and integrate typographic styles.

Then you will create the application interface. You will see how to import images and work with symbols in your project. Then you will know the Grid tool to optimize processes, and Arturo will explain how to integrate your user interface for iOS and Android.

You will continue your learning, this time focused on something fundamental: the organization. You will discover the utility of working with smart guides and learn how to use the layer panel properly. Next, you will see how to work with folders and, also, how to fix items within the application. Then, you will see the advantages of working with an Adobe CC library.

To end this Adobe XD Domestika Basics, you will create an interactive prototype of your application. Arturo will explain the importance of the initial screen and, once you have built all the screens of the application, it will teach you how to link the sections, as well as how to edit and correct the links. You will see different preview options, to finally know the different ways to share your prototype and receive comments.

How You’ll Learn

This course is divided into 5 parts, 38 lessons in total. They also provide 36 downloads to help you follow along with the instructor. By completing the 5 courses you will receive a certificate.

Provider Domestika
Instructor(s) Arturo Servín
Level Beginner
Workload 7-8 hours
Enrollments 8,997
Rating 100% positive (275)
Certificate Available

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

9. Prototyping a WordPress Project in Adobe XD (LinkedIn Learning) 

Learn how to use Adobe XD to create a WordPress website prototype that you can share with clients, developers, and other stakeholders. Explore the UX (user experience) process and see how to create sitemaps, personas, wireframes, and style guides. Discover how to utilize these assets to plan a layout and create responsive mockups, incorporate assets from Photoshop and Illustrator, and make your prototypes interactive. Throughout the process, see how to effectively communicate your intentions to clients and other stakeholders as well as collaborate with others. Finally, learn how to export a prototype from Adobe XD in a variety of sizes and formats, and have specific direction and assets for use in WordPress.

This is the best course ever for learning to prototype, thank you. – Mahmoud Khalaf, learner

What You’ll Learn

  1. Get Familiar with the Project What is UX and UI?; UX workflow; Consider your client/website project; Outline the needs of end user; Take inventory of available assets; Create site map; Get familiar with WordPress themes
  2. Approach the Project: Use the content first design; Starting with wireframe or UI kits
  3. Get Started in Adobe XD: Create wireframes; Using the Adobe library; Layout sections with labels; Using assets for consistency; Creating components; Component overrides
  4. Workflow for Building the Site: Create a style guide artboard; Start mobile first; Layout pages with content; Repeat grid; Importing content; Plugins
  5. Building Interactivity: Animation overview; Menu animation; Carousels; Lightbox; Draggable carousel
  6. Finalizing the Prototype: Convert a page layout by re-using assets; Finessing your prototype
  7. Sharing and Exporting: Sharing your Adobe XD file; Collaborate with others using the cloud; Using linked assets; Export assets from XD

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 7 modules and 37 videos, you will learn by following along with the instructor and experimenting with Adobe XD by yourself. Upon completion of all content you will receive a certificate to upload to your profile.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor(s) Emily Kay
Level Beginner
Workload 2-3 hours
Enrollments 7,317
Rating 4.8 (60 ratings)
Certificate Available

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

10. Creación de prototipos interactivos con Adobe XD (Domestika)

Learn how to find solutions to user problems and create accurate animated prototypes for digital products. Learn how to make animated prototypes with Adobe XD. Plus, solve digital product problems and develop a prototype that’s faithful to your final product, testing it with real users on any mobile device. This course audio is in Spanish, with subtitles in English.

Un excelente curso para mejorar mis habilidades en Adobe XD, el curso fue fácil de seguir gracias a las claras explicaciones del profesor José y gracias a sus enseñanzas pude aplicarlas en mi portfolio y así conseguir mi primer trabajo como UXUI Designer. Recomendado 100%, Gracias José! – lizodem17, learner

What You’ll Learn

First, it’s important to understand what a digital product is. See how we interact with them everyday and understand the work that goes into each one. A key element is prototyping, so learn what a prototype is and why animating it is better.

Next, it’s time to sketch the interface on paper and import it into Adobe XD. Based on your research and goals, start exploring different visual styles to make UI decisions until you’ve completed your digital workflow.

Then, bring your interface to life by adding links and animating each interaction with Adobe XD. See how to test the full experience and look for ways to improve your final prototype.

At the end of this course, José shows you his final steps for testing a prototype. Finally, see the best ways for sharing your work with other teams as a way to continue developing on the project.

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 17 lessons and 15 exercises, you will follow along with the instructor using the 22 additional resources you can download to help you through the course. The final project is “Develop a high-fidelity interactive prototype of a digital product”, you can submit and receive feedback from other learners and check their projects for inspiration as well. By completing all the videos, you will receive a certificate of completion.

Provider Domestika
Instructor(s) José Galeano
Level Beginner
Workload 2-3 hours
Enrollments 1,149
Rating 98% positive (53 ratings)
Certificate Available

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.
